tool.name: BiobbCanion
tool.description: : Wrapper for the Canion executable that is part of the Curves+ software suite.

param.name: input_cdi_path
param.label: input CDI file
param.help: Trajectory input file. Format: [input].cdi

param.name: input_afr_path
param.label: input AFR file
param.help: Helical axis frames corresponding to the input conformation to be analyzed. Format: [input].afr

param.name: input_avg_struc_path
param.label: input PDB file
param.help: Average DNA conformation. Format: [input].pdb

param.name: outname_output_zip_path
param.label: output ZIP name
param.help: Filename for .zip files containing Canion output files Format: [output].zip

param.name: sele
param.label: Take tool settings:
param.help: Select where tool settings are to be read from

param.name: properties
param.label: Configuration file
param.help: File containing tool settings. See below for the syntax

param.name: jsonstr
param.label: JSON string
param.help: JSON string containing tool settings. See below for the syntax

param.name: bases
param.label: bases
param.help: Sequence of bases to be analyzed (default is blank, meaning no specified sequence).

param.name: type
param.label: type
param.help: Ions (or atoms) to be analyzed. Options are 'Na+', 'K', 'K+', 'Cl', 'Cl-', 'CL', 'P', 'C1*', 'NH1', 'NH2', 'NZ', '1' for all cations, '-1' for all anions, '0' for neutral species or '*' for all available data.

param.name: dlow
param.label: dlow
param.help: Select starting segment of the oglimer to analyze. If both dhig and dlow are 0, entire oglimer is analyzed.

param.name: dhig
param.label: dhig
param.help: Select ending segment of the oglimer to analyze, being the maximum value the total number of base pairs in the oligomer. If both dhig and dlow are 0, entire oglimer is analyzed.

param.name: rlow
param.label: rlow
param.help: Minimal distances from the helical axis taken into account in the analysis.

param.name: rhig
param.label: rhig
param.help: Maximal distances from the helical axis taken into account in the analysis.

param.name: alow
param.label: alow
param.help: Minimal angle range to analyze.

param.name: ahig
param.label: ahig
param.help: Maximal angle range to analyze.

param.name: itst
param.label: itst
param.help: Number of first snapshot to be analyzed.

param.name: itnd
param.label: itnd
param.help: Number of last snapshot to be analyzed.

param.name: itdel
param.label: itdel
param.help: Spacing between analyzed snapshots.

param.name: rmsf
param.label: rmsf
param.help: If set to True uses the combination of the helical ion parameters and an average helical axis to map the ions into Cartesian space and then calculates their average position (pdb output) and their root mean square fluctuation values (rmsf output). A single pass rmsf algorithm to make this calculation possible with a single read of the trajectory file. This option is generally used for solute atoms and not for solvent molecules or ions.

param.name: circ
param.label: circ
param.help: If set to True, minicircles are analyzed.

param.name: binary_path
param.label: binary_path
param.help: Path to Canion executable, otherwise the program wil look for Canion executable in the binaries folder.
